member.name: T:ImageSharp.Color
member.summary: Packed pixel type containing four 8-bit unsigned normalized values ranging from 0 to 255. The color components are stored in red, green, blue, and alpha order.
member.remarks: This struct is fully mutable. This is done (against the guidelines) for the sake of performance, as it avoids the need to create new values for modification operations.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Color.GetColorComponent(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the color component from the given values.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Color.MoveIntoRange(System.Single)
member.summary: Moves the specific value within the acceptable range for conversion. Used for converting colors to this type.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Color.op_Addition(ImageSharp.Color,ImageSharp.Color)
member.summary: Adds the second color to the first.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Color.op_Subtraction(ImageSharp.Color,ImageSharp.Color)
member.summary: Subtracts the second color from the first.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Color.Normal(ImageSharp.Color,ImageSharp.Color)
member.summary: The blending formula simply selects the source color.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Color.Multiply(ImageSharp.Color,ImageSharp.Color)
member.summary:
Blends two colors by multiplication.
The source color is multiplied by the destination color and replaces the destination. The resultant color is always at least as dark as either the source or destination color. Multiplying any color with black results in black. Multiplying any color with white preserves the original color.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Color.Screen(ImageSharp.Color,ImageSharp.Color)
member.summary:
Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complements the result.
The result color is always at least as light as either of the two constituent colors. Screening any color with white produces white; screening with black leaves the original color unchanged. The effect is similar to projecting multiple photographic slides simultaneously onto a single screen.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Color.HardLight(ImageSharp.Color,ImageSharp.Color)
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source color value. The effect is similar to shining a harsh spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Color.Overlay(ImageSharp.Color,ImageSharp.Color)
member.summary:
Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the backdrop color value.
Source colors overlay the backdrop while preserving its highlights and shadows. The backdrop color is not replaced but is mixed with the source color to reflect the lightness or darkness of the backdrop.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Color.Darken(ImageSharp.Color,ImageSharp.Color)
member.summary: Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors. The backdrop is replaced with the source where the source is darker; otherwise, it is left unchanged.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Color.Lighten(ImageSharp.Color,ImageSharp.Color)
member.summary: Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors. The backdrop is replaced with the source where the source is lighter; otherwise, it is left unchanged.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Color.SoftLight(ImageSharp.Color,ImageSharp.Color)
member.summary: Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the source color value. The effect is similar to shining a diffused spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Color.ColorDodge(ImageSharp.Color,ImageSharp.Color)
member.summary: Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. Painting with black produces no changes.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Color.ColorBurn(ImageSharp.Color,ImageSharp.Color)
member.summary: Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. Painting with white produces no change.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Color.Difference(ImageSharp.Color,ImageSharp.Color)
member.summary: Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color. Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Color.Exclusion(ImageSharp.Color,ImageSharp.Color)
member.summary: Produces an effect similar to that of the mode but lower in contrast. Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Color.Lerp(ImageSharp.Color,ImageSharp.Color,System.Single)
member.summary: Linearly interpolates from one color to another based on the given weighting.
member.param: A value between 0 and 1 indicating the weight of the second source vector. At amount = 0, "from" is returned, at amount = 1, "to" is returned.

member.summary: Transform algorithms that match the equations defined in the W3C Compositing and Blending Level 1 specification.

member.summary: The epsilon for comparing floating point numbers.

member.summary: The blending formula simply selects the source vector.

member.summary: Blends two vectors by multiplication.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Vector4BlendTransforms.Screen(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source vector values, then complements the result.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Vector4BlendTransforms.HardLight(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source vector value.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Vector4BlendTransforms.Overlay(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the vectors, depending on the backdrop vector value.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Vector4BlendTransforms.Darken(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Selects the minimum of the backdrop and source vectors.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Vector4BlendTransforms.Lighten(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Selects the max of the backdrop and source vector.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Vector4BlendTransforms.SoftLight(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Selects the maximum or minimum of the vectors, depending on the source vector value.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Vector4BlendTransforms.Dodge(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Increases the backdrop vector to reflect the source vector.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Vector4BlendTransforms.Burn(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Decreases the backdrop vector to reflect the source vector.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Vector4BlendTransforms.Difference(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Subtracts the minimum of the two constituent vectors from the maximum vector.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Vector4BlendTransforms.Exclusion(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Produces an effect similar to that of the mode but lower in magnitude.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Vector4BlendTransforms.PremultipliedLerp(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Single)
member.summary: Linearly interpolates from one vector to another based on the given weighting. The two vectors are premultiplied before operating.
member.param: A value between 0 and 1 indicating the weight of the second source vector. At amount = 0, "from" is returned, at amount = 1, "to" is returned.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Vector4BlendTransforms.BlendOverlay(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the backdrop component, depending on the component value.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Vector4BlendTransforms.BlendSoftLight(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Darkens or lightens the backdrop component, depending on the source component value.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Vector4BlendTransforms.BlendDodge(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Brightens the backdrop component to reflect the source component.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Vector4BlendTransforms.BlendBurn(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Darkens the backdrop component to reflect the source component.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Vector4BlendTransforms.BlendExclusion(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Darkens the backdrop component to reflect the source component.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Drawing.Brushes.PatternBrush`1
member.summary: Provides an implementation of a pattern brush for painting patterns.
member.remarks:
The patterns that are used to create a custom pattern brush are made up of a repeating matrix of flags, where each flag denotes whether to draw the foreground color or the background color. so to create a new bool[,] with your flags
For example if you wanted to create a diagonal line that repeat every 4 pixels you would use a pattern like so 1000 0100 0010 0001
or you want a horizontal stripe which is 3 pixels apart you would use a pattern like 1 0 0
Warning when use array initializer across multiple lines the bools look inverted i.e. new bool[,]{ {true, false, false}, {false,true, false} } would be 10 01 00

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Drawing.Pens.Pen`1
member.summary: Provides a pen that can apply a pattern to a line with a set brush and thickness
member.remarks: The pattern will be in to the form of new float[]{ 1f, 2f, 0.5f} this will be converted into a pattern that is 3.5 times longer that the width with 3 sections section 1 will be width long (making a square) and will be filled by the brush section 2 will be width * 2 long and will be empty section 3 will be width/2 long and will be filled the the pattern will imidiatly repeat without gap.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.ResizeMode
member.summary: Enumerated resize modes to apply to resized images.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.ResizeMode.Crop
member.summary: Crops the resized image to fit the bounds of its container.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.ResizeMode.Pad
member.summary: Pads the resized image to fit the bounds of its container. If only one dimension is passed, will maintain the original aspect ratio.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.ResizeMode.BoxPad
member.summary: Pads the image to fit the bound of the container without resizing the original source. When downscaling, performs the same functionality as

member.name: F:ImageSharp.ResizeMode.Max
member.summary: Constrains the resized image to fit the bounds of its container maintaining the original aspect ratio.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.ResizeMode.Min
member.summary: Resizes the image until the shortest side reaches the set given dimension. Upscaling is disabled in this mode and the original image will be returned if attempted.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.ResizeMode.Stretch
member.summary: Stretches the resized image to fit the bounds of its container.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.BicubicResampler
member.summary: The function implements the bicubic kernel algorithm W(x) as described on Wikipedia A commonly used algorithm within imageprocessing that preserves sharpness better than triangle interpolation.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.BoxResampler
member.summary: The function implements the box algorithm. Similar to nearest neighbor when upscaling. When downscaling the pixels will average, merging together.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.CatmullRomResampler
member.summary: The Catmull-Rom filter is a well known standard Cubic Filter often used as a interpolation function. This filter produces a reasonably sharp edge, but without a the pronounced gradient change on large scale image enlargements that a 'Lagrange' filter can produce.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.IResampler
member.summary: Encapsulates an interpolation algorithm for resampling images.

member.summary: Gets the radius in which to sample pixels.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.IResampler.GetValue(System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the result of the interpolation algorithm.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Lanczos2Resampler
member.summary: The function implements the Lanczos kernel algorithm as described on Wikipedia with a radius of 2 pixels.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Lanczos3Resampler
member.summary: The function implements the Lanczos kernel algorithm as described on Wikipedia with a radius of 3 pixels.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Lanczos5Resampler
member.summary: The function implements the Lanczos kernel algorithm as described on Wikipedia with a radius of 5 pixels.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Lanczos8Resampler
member.summary: The function implements the Lanczos kernel algorithm as described on Wikipedia with a radius of 8 pixels.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.MitchellNetravaliResampler
member.summary: The function implements the mitchell algorithm as described on Wikipedia

member.name: T:ImageSharp.NearestNeighborResampler
member.summary: The function implements the nearest neighbor algorithm. This uses an unscaled filter which will select the closest pixel to the new pixels position.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.RobidouxResampler
member.summary: The function implements the Robidoux algorithm.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.RobidouxSharpResampler
member.summary: The function implements the Robidoux Sharp algorithm.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.SplineResampler
member.summary: The function implements the spline algorithm.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.TriangleResampler
member.summary: The function implements the triangle (bilinear) algorithm. Bilinear interpolation can be used where perfect image transformation with pixel matching is impossible, so that one can calculate and assign appropriate intensity values to pixels.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.WelchResampler
member.summary: The function implements the welch algorithm.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpBitsPerPixel
member.summary: Enumerates the available bits per pixel for bitmap.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpBitsPerPixel.Pixel24
member.summary: 24 bits per pixel. Each pixel consists of 3 bytes.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpBitsPerPixel.Pixel32
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel. Each pixel consists of 4 bytes.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpCompression
member.summary: Defines how the compression type of the image data in the bitmap file.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpCompression.RGB
member.summary: Each image row has a multiple of four elements. If the row has less elements, zeros will be added at the right side. The format depends on the number of bits, stored in the info header. If the number of bits are one, four or eight each pixel data is a index to the palette. If the number of bits are sixteen, twenty-four or thirty-two each pixel contains a color.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpCompression.RLE8
member.summary: Two bytes are one data record. If the first byte is not zero, the next two half bytes will be repeated as much as the value of the first byte. If the first byte is zero, the record has different meanings, depending on the second byte. If the second byte is zero, it is the end of the row, if it is one, it is the end of the image. Not supported at the moment.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpCompression.RLE4
member.summary: Two bytes are one data record. If the first byte is not zero, the next byte will be repeated as much as the value of the first byte. If the first byte is zero, the record has different meanings, depending on the second byte. If the second byte is zero, it is the end of the row, if it is one, it is the end of the image. Not supported at the moment.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpCompression.BitFields
member.summary: Each image row has a multiple of four elements. If the row has less elements, zeros will be added at the right side. Not supported at the moment.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpCompression.JPEG
member.summary: The bitmap contains a JPG image. Not supported at the moment.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpCompression.PNG
member.summary: The bitmap contains a PNG image. Not supported at the moment.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpDecoder
member.summary: Image decoder for generating an image out of a Windows bitmap stream.
member.remarks:
Does not support the following formats at the moment:
JPG
PNG
RLE4
RLE8
BitFields
Formats will be supported in a later releases. We advise always to use only 24 Bit Windows bitmaps.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpFileHeader
member.summary: Stores general information about the Bitmap file.
member.remarks: The first two bytes of the Bitmap file format (thus the Bitmap header) are stored in big-endian order. All of the other integer values are stored in little-endian format (i.e. least-significant byte first).

member.summary: Defines of the data structure in the bitmap file.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Bitmap identifier. The field used to identify the bitmap file: 0x42 0x4D (Hex code points for B and M)

member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the bitmap file in bytes.

member.summary: Gets or sets any reserved data; actual value depends on the application that creates the image.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpFileHeader.Offset
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset, i.e. starting address, of the byte where the bitmap data can be found.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of color planes being used. Must be set to 1.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of bits per pixel, which is the color depth of the image. Typical values are 1, 4, 8, 16, 24 and 32.

member.summary: Gets or sets the compression method being used. See the next table for a list of possible values.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpInfoHeader.ImageSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the image size. This is the size of the raw bitmap data (see below), and should not be confused with the file size.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpInfoHeader.XPelsPerMeter
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal resolution of the image. (pixel per meter, signed integer)

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpInfoHeader.YPelsPerMeter
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical resolution of the image. (pixel per meter, signed integer)

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpInfoHeader.ClrUsed
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of colors in the color palette, or 0 to default to 2^n.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpInfoHeader.ClrImportant
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of important colors used, or 0 when every color is important{ get; set; } generally ignored.

member.summary: No disposal specified. The decoder is not required to take any action.

member.summary: Do not dispose. The graphic is to be left in place.

member.summary: Restore to background color. The area used by the graphic must be restored to the background color.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.DisposalMethod.RestoreToPrevious
member.summary: Restore to previous. The decoder is required to restore the area overwritten by the graphic with what was there prior to rendering the graphic.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.LzwEncoder
member.summary: Encodes and compresses the image data using dynamic Lempel-Ziv compression.
member.remarks:
Adapted from Jef Poskanzer's Java port by way of J. M. G. Elliott. K Weiner 12/00
GIFCOMPR.C - GIF Image compression routines
Lempel-Ziv compression based on 'compress'. GIF modifications by David Rowley (mgardi@watdcsu.waterloo.edu)
GIF Image compression - modified 'compress'
Based on: compress.c - File compression ala IEEE Computer, June 1984. By Authors: Spencer W. Thomas (decvax!harpo!utah-cs!utah-gr!thomas) Jim McKie (decvax!mcvax!jim) Steve Davies (decvax!vax135!petsd!peora!srd) Ken Turkowski (decvax!decwrl!turtlevax!ken) James A. Woods (decvax!ihnp4!ames!jaw) Joe Orost (decvax!vax135!petsd!joe)

member.summary: Block compression parameters -- after all codes are used up, and compression rate changes, start over.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.LzwEncoder.globalInitialBits
member.summary: Algorithm: use open addressing double hashing (no chaining) on the prefix code / next character combination. We do a variant of Knuth's algorithm D (vol. 3, sec. 6.4) along with G. Knott's relatively-prime secondary probe. Here, the modular division first probe is gives way to a faster exclusive-or manipulation. Also do block compression with an adaptive reset, whereby the code table is cleared when the compression ratio decreases, but after the table fills. The variable-length output codes are re-sized at this point, and a special CLEAR code is generated for the decompressor. Late addition: construct the table according to file size for noticeable speed improvement on small files. Please direct questions about this implementation to ames!jaw.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.LzwEncoder.clearCode
member.summary: The clear code.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.LzwEncoder.eofCode
member.summary: The end-of-file code.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.LzwEncoder.currentAccumulator
member.summary: Output the given code. Inputs: code: A bitCount-bit integer. If == -1, then EOF. This assumes that bitCount =< wordsize - 1. Outputs: Outputs code to the file. Assumptions: Chars are 8 bits long. Algorithm: Maintain a BITS character long buffer (so that 8 codes will fit in it exactly). Use the VAX insv instruction to insert each code in turn. When the buffer fills up empty it and start over.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.GifGraphicsControlExtension
member.summary: The Graphic Control Extension contains parameters used when processing a graphic rendering block.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifGraphicsControlExtension.DisposalMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the disposal method which indicates the way in which the graphic is to be treated after being displayed.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifGraphicsControlExtension.TransparencyFlag
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether transparency flag is to be set. This indicates whether a transparency index is given in the Transparent Index field. (This field is the least significant bit of the byte.)

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifGraphicsControlExtension.TransparencyIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the transparency index. The Transparency Index is such that when encountered, the corresponding pixel of the display device is not modified and processing goes on to the next pixel.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifGraphicsControlExtension.DelayTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay time. If not 0, this field specifies the number of hundredths (1/100) of a second to wait before continuing with the processing of the Data Stream. The clock starts ticking immediately after the graphic is rendered.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.GifImageDescriptor
member.summary: Each image in the Data Stream is composed of an Image Descriptor, an optional Local Color Table, and the image data. Each image must fit within the boundaries of the Logical Screen, as defined in the Logical Screen Descriptor.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifImageDescriptor.Left
member.summary: Gets or sets the column number, in pixels, of the left edge of the image, with respect to the left edge of the Logical Screen. Leftmost column of the Logical Screen is 0.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifImageDescriptor.Top
member.summary: Gets or sets the row number, in pixels, of the top edge of the image with respect to the top edge of the Logical Screen. Top row of the Logical Screen is 0.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifImageDescriptor.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the image in pixels.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifImageDescriptor.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the image in pixels.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifImageDescriptor.LocalColorTableFlag
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the presence of a Local Color Table immediately follows this Image Descriptor.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifImageDescriptor.LocalColorTableSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the local color table size. If the Local Color Table Flag is set to 1, the value in this field is used to calculate the number of bytes contained in the Local Color Table.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifImageDescriptor.InterlaceFlag
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the image is to be interlaced. An image is interlaced in a four-pass interlace pattern.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.GifLogicalScreenDescriptor
member.summary: The Logical Screen Descriptor contains the parameters necessary to define the area of the display device within which the images will be rendered

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifLogicalScreenDescriptor.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width, in pixels, of the Logical Screen where the images will be rendered in the displaying device.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifLogicalScreenDescriptor.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height, in pixels, of the Logical Screen where the images will be rendered in the displaying device.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifLogicalScreenDescriptor.BackgroundColorIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index at the Global Color Table for the Background Color. The Background Color is the color used for those pixels on the screen that are not covered by an image.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifLogicalScreenDescriptor.PixelAspectRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets the pixel aspect ratio. Default to 0.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifLogicalScreenDescriptor.GlobalColorTableFlag
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a flag denoting the presence of a Global Color Table should be set. If the flag is set, the Global Color Table will immediately follow the Logical Screen Descriptor.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifLogicalScreenDescriptor.GlobalColorTableSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the global color table size. If the Global Color Table Flag is set to 1, the value in this field is used to calculate the number of bytes contained in the Global Color Table.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers
member.summary: Describes common Jpeg markers

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.XFF
member.summary: Marker prefix. Next byte is a marker.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.SOI
member.summary: Start of Image

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.SOF0
member.summary:
Start of Frame (baseline DCT)
Indicates that this is a baseline DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.SOF1
member.summary:
Start Of Frame (Extended Sequential DCT)
Indicates that this is a progressive DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.SOF2
member.summary:
Start Of Frame (progressive DCT)
Indicates that this is a progressive DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.DHT
member.summary:
Define Huffman Table(s)
Specifies one or more Huffman tables.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.DQT
member.summary:
Define Quantization Table(s)
Specifies one or more quantization tables.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.DRI
member.summary:
Define Restart Interval
Specifies the interval between RSTn markers, in macroblocks. This marker is followed by two bytes indicating the fixed size so it can be treated like any other variable size segment.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.RST0
member.summary:
Define First Restart
Inserted every r macroblocks, where r is the restart interval set by a DRI marker. Not used if there was no DRI marker. The low three bits of the marker code cycle in value from 0 to 7.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.RST7
member.summary:
Define Eigth Restart
Inserted every r macroblocks, where r is the restart interval set by a DRI marker. Not used if there was no DRI marker. The low three bits of the marker code cycle in value from 0 to 7.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.SOS
member.summary:
Start of Scan
Begins a top-to-bottom scan of the image. In baseline DCT JPEG images, there is generally a single scan. Progressive DCT JPEG images usually contain multiple scans. This marker specifies which slice of data it will contain, and is immediately followed by entropy-coded data.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.COM
member.summary:
Comment
Contains a text comment.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.EOI
member.summary: End of Image

member.summary: Application specific marker for marking the jpeg format.

member.summary: Application specific marker for marking where to store metadata.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.APP15
member.summary: Application specific marker used by GraphicConverter to store JPEG quality.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegDecoderCore.Unzig
member.summary: Unzig maps from the zigzag ordering to the natural ordering. For example, unzig[3] is the column and row of the fourth element in zigzag order. The value is 16, which means first column (16%8 == 0) and third row (16/8 == 2).

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegDecoderCore.UnreadByteStuffedByte
member.summary: Undoes the most recent ReadByteStuffedByte call, giving a byte of data back from bits to bytes. The Huffman look-up table requires at least 8 bits for look-up, which means that Huffman decoding can sometimes overshoot and read one or two too many bytes. Two-byte overshoot can happen when expecting to read a 0xff 0x00 byte-stuffed byte.

member.summary: Processes the "Adobe" APP14 segment stores image encoding information for DCT filters. This segment may be copied or deleted as a block using the Extra "Adobe" tag, but note that it is not deleted by default when deleting all metadata because it may affect the appearance of the image.

member.summary: The number of quantization tables.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegEncoderCore.Unzig
member.summary: Maps from the zig-zag ordering to the natural ordering. For example, unzig[3] is the column and row of the fourth element in zig-zag order. The value is 16, which means first column (16%8 == 0) and third row (16/8 == 2).

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegEncoderCore.TheHuffmanSpecs
member.summary: The Huffman encoding specifications. This encoder uses the same Huffman encoding for all images.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegEncoderCore.TheHuffmanLut
member.summary: The compiled representations of theHuffmanSpec.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegEncoderCore.bitCountLut
member.summary: Counts the number of bits needed to hold an integer.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegEncoderCore.unscaledQuant
member.summary: The unscaled quantization tables in zig-zag order. Each encoder copies and scales the tables according to its quality parameter. The values are derived from section K.1 after converting from natural to zig-zag order.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegEncoderCore.buffer
member.summary: A scratch buffer to reduce allocations.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegEncoderCore.emitBuffer
member.summary: A buffer for reducing the number of stream writes when emitting Huffman tables. 64 seems to be enough.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegEncoderCore.huffmanBuffer
member.summary: A buffer for reducing the number of stream writes when emitting Huffman tables. Max combined table lengths + identifier.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegEncoderCore.quant
member.summary: The scaled quantization tables, in zig-zag order.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegEncoderCore.sosHeaderYCbCr
member.summary: The SOS (Start Of Scan) marker "\xff\xda" followed by 12 bytes: - the marker length "\x00\x0c", - the number of components "\x03", - component 1 uses DC table 0 and AC table 0 "\x01\x00", - component 2 uses DC table 1 and AC table 1 "\x02\x11", - component 3 uses DC table 1 and AC table 1 "\x03\x11", - the bytes "\x00\x3f\x00". Section B.2.3 of the spec says that for sequential DCTs, those bytes (8-bit Ss, 8-bit Se, 4-bit Ah, 4-bit Al) should be 0x00, 0x3f, 0x00<<4 | 0x00.

member.summary: The accumulated bit count.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.Bytes
member.summary: Bytes is a byte buffer, similar to a stream, except that it has to be able to unread more than 1 byte, due to byte stuffing. Byte stuffing is specified in section F.1.2.3.

member.summary: End of bytes read

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.Bytes.UnreadableBytes

member.summary: Gets the array of maximum codes. MaxCodes[i] is the maximum code of length i, or -1 if there are no codes of that length.

member.summary: Gets the array of indices. Indices[i] is the index into Values of MinCodes[i].

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.IDCT
member.summary: Performs a 2-D Inverse Discrete Cosine Transformation.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Formats.IDCT.Transform(ImageSharp.Formats.Block@)
member.summary:
Performs a 2-D Inverse Discrete Cosine Transformation.
The input coefficients should already have been multiplied by the appropriate quantization table. We use fixed-point computation, with the number of bits for the fractional component varying over the intermediate stages.
For more on the actual algorithm, see Z. Wang, "Fast algorithms for the discrete W transform and for the discrete Fourier transform", IEEE Trans. on ASSP, Vol. ASSP- 32, pp. 803-816, Aug. 1984.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunk
member.summary: Stores header information about a chunk.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunk.Length
member.summary: Gets or sets the length. An unsigned integer giving the number of bytes in the chunk's data field. The length counts only the data field, not itself, the chunk type code, or the CRC. Zero is a valid length

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunk.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the chunk type as string with 4 chars.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunk.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the data bytes appropriate to the chunk type, if any. This field can be of zero length.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunk.Crc
member.summary: Gets or sets a CRC (Cyclic Redundancy Check) calculated on the preceding bytes in the chunk, including the chunk type code and chunk data fields, but not including the length field. The CRC is always present, even for chunks containing no data

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunkTypes
member.summary: Contains a list of possible chunk type identifiers.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunkTypes.Header
member.summary: The first chunk in a png file. Can only exists once. Contains common information like the width and the height of the image or the used compression method.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunkTypes.Palette
member.summary: The PLTE chunk contains from 1 to 256 palette entries, each a three byte series in the RGB format.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunkTypes.Data
member.summary: The IDAT chunk contains the actual image data. The image can contains more than one chunk of this type. All chunks together are the whole image.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunkTypes.End
member.summary: This chunk must appear last. It marks the end of the PNG data stream. The chunk's data field is empty.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunkTypes.PaletteAlpha
member.summary: This chunk specifies that the image uses simple transparency: either alpha values associated with palette entries (for indexed-color images) or a single transparent color (for grayscale and true color images).

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunkTypes.Text
member.summary: Textual information that the encoder wishes to record with the image can be stored in tEXt chunks. Each tEXt chunk contains a keyword and a text string.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunkTypes.Gamma
member.summary: This chunk specifies the relationship between the image samples and the desired display output intensity.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunkTypes.Physical
member.summary: The pHYs chunk specifies the intended pixel size or aspect ratio for display of the image.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.PngColorType
member.summary: Provides enumeration of available PNG color types.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngColorType.Grayscale
member.summary: Each pixel is a grayscale sample.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngColorType.Rgb
member.summary: Each pixel is an R,G,B triple.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngColorType.Palette
member.summary: Each pixel is a palette index; a PLTE chunk must appear.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngColorType.GrayscaleWithAlpha
member.summary: Each pixel is a grayscale sample, followed by an alpha sample.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngColorType.RgbWithAlpha
member.summary: Each pixel is an R,G,B triple, followed by an alpha sample.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.PngDecoder
member.summary: Encoder for generating an image out of a png encoded stream.
member.remarks:
At the moment the following features are supported:
Filters: all filters are supported.
Pixel formats:
RGBA (True color) with alpha (8 bit).
RGB (True color) without alpha (8 bit).
Grayscale with alpha (8 bit).
Grayscale without alpha (8 bit).
Palette Index with alpha (8 bit).
Palette Index without alpha (8 bit).

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.Adler32
member.summary: Computes Adler32 checksum for a stream of data. An Adler32 checksum is not as reliable as a CRC32 checksum, but a lot faster to compute.
member.remarks:
The specification for Adler32 may be found in RFC 1950. ZLIB Compressed Data Format Specification version 3.3)
From that document:
"ADLER32 (Adler-32 checksum) This contains a checksum value of the uncompressed data (excluding any dictionary data) computed according to Adler-32 algorithm. This algorithm is a 32-bit extension and improvement of the Fletcher algorithm, used in the ITU-T X.224 / ISO 8073 standard.
Adler-32 is composed of two sums accumulated per byte: s1 is the sum of all bytes, s2 is the sum of all s1 values. Both sums are done modulo 65521. s1 is initialized to 1, s2 to zero. The Adler-32 checksum is stored as s2*65536 + s1 in most- significant-byte first (network) order."
"8.2. The Adler-32 algorithm
The Adler-32 algorithm is much faster than the CRC32 algorithm yet still provides an extremely low probability of undetected errors.
The modulo on unsigned long accumulators can be delayed for 5552 bytes, so the modulo operation time is negligible. If the bytes are a, b, c, the second sum is 3a + 2b + c + 3, and so is position and order sensitive, unlike the first sum, which is just a checksum. That 65521 is prime is important to avoid a possible large class of two-byte errors that leave the check unchanged. (The Fletcher checksum uses 255, which is not prime and which also makes the Fletcher check insensitive to single byte changes 0 - 255.)
The sum s1 is initialized to 1 instead of zero to make the length of the sequence part of s2, so that the length does not have to be checked separately. (Any sequence of zeroes has a Fletcher checksum of zero.)"

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.Adler32.Base
member.summary: largest prime smaller than 65536

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.Adler32.checksum
member.summary: The checksum calculated to far.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Formats.Adler32.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. The checksum starts off with a value of 1.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Formats.Adler32.Update(System.Int32)
member.summary: Updates the checksum with a byte value.
member.param: The data value to add. The high byte of the int is ignored.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.Crc32
member.summary: Generate a table for a byte-wise 32-bit CRC calculation on the polynomial: x^32+x^26+x^23+x^22+x^16+x^12+x^11+x^10+x^8+x^7+x^5+x^4+x^2+x+1.

remarks.para: Polynomials over GF(2) are represented in binary, one bit per coefficient, with the lowest powers in the most significant bit. Then adding polynomials is just exclusive-or, and multiplying a polynomial by x is a right shift by one. If we call the above polynomial p, and represent a byte as the polynomial q, also with the lowest power in the most significant bit (so the byte 0xb1 is the polynomial x^7+x^3+x+1), then the CRC is (q*x^32) mod p, where a mod b means the remainder after dividing a by b.

This calculation is done using the shift-register method of multiplying and taking the remainder. The register is initialized to zero, and for each incoming bit, x^32 is added mod p to the register if the bit is a one (where x^32 mod p is p+x^32 = x^26+...+1), and the register is multiplied mod p by x (which is shifting right by one and adding x^32 mod p if the bit shifted out is a one). We start with the highest power (least significant bit) of q and repeat for all eight bits of q.

The table is simply the CRC of all possible eight bit values. This is all the information needed to generate CRC's on data a byte at a time for all combinations of CRC register values and incoming bytes.

member.summary: The cycle redundancy check seed

member.summary: Updates the checksum with the given value.
member.param: The byte is taken as the lower 8 bits of value.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.IChecksum
member.summary: Interface to compute a data checksum used by checked input/output streams. A data checksum can be updated by one byte or with a byte array. After each update the value of the current checksum can be returned by calling Value. The complete checksum object can also be reset so it can be used again with new data.

member.remarks: If the entity is disposed, it must not be disposed a second time. The isDisposed field is set the first time the entity is disposed. member.param: The buffer to copy data into
The first index to copy data into
The number of characters to read

member.param: The buffer to copy data into

member.name: M:ImageSharp.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadBytesOrThrow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the specified number of bytes, returning them in a new byte array. If not enough bytes are available before the end of the stream, this method will throw an IOException.
member.param: The number of bytes to read

member.name: M:ImageSharp.IO.EndianBinaryReader.Read7BitEncodedInt
member.summary: Reads a 7-bit encoded integer from the stream. This is stored with the least significant information first, with 7 bits of information per byte of value, and the top bit as a continuation flag. This method is not affected by the endianness of the bit converter.
member.returns: The 7-bit encoded integer read from the stream.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadBigEndian7BitEncodedInt
member.summary: Reads a 7-bit encoded integer from the stream. This is stored with the most significant information first, with 7 bits of information per byte of value, and the top bit as a continuation flag. This method is not affected by the endianness of the bit converter.
member.returns: The 7-bit encoded integer read from the stream.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadString
member.summary: Reads a length-prefixed string from the stream, using the encoding for this reader. A 7-bit encoded integer is first read, which specifies the number of bytes to read from the stream. These bytes are then converted into a string with the encoding for this reader.
member.returns: The string read from the stream.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.IO.EndianBitConverter.IsLittleEndian
member.summary: Indicates the byte order ("endianness") in which data is converted using this class.
member.remarks: Different computer architectures store data using different byte orders. "Big-endian" means the most significant byte is on the left end of a word. "Little-endian" means the most significant byte is on the right end of a word.
member.returns: true if this converter is little-endian, false otherwise.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.IO.EndianBitConverter.Endianness
member.summary: Gets the byte order ("endianness") in which data is converted using this class.

member.summary: The big-endian bit converter.

member.summary: Gets a big-endian bit converter instance. The same instance is always returned.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Quantizers.WuQuantizer`1
member.summary: An implementation of Wu's color quantizer with alpha channel.

remarks.para: Based on C Implementation of Xiaolin Wu's Color Quantizer (v. 2) (see Graphics Gems volume II, pages 126-133) ().
This adaptation is based on the excellent JeremyAnsel.ColorQuant by Jérémy Ansel

Algorithm: Greedy orthogonal bipartition of RGB space for variance minimization aided by inclusion-exclusion tricks. For speed no nearest neighbor search is done. Slightly better performance can be expected by more sophisticated but more expensive versions.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Quantizers.WuQuantizer`1.Variance(ImageSharp.Quantizers.Box)
member.summary: Computes the weighted variance of a box cube.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Quantizers.WuQuantizer`1.Maximize(ImageSharp.Quantizers.Box,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: We want to minimize the sum of the variances of two sub-boxes. The sum(c^2) terms can be ignored since their sum over both sub-boxes is the same (the sum for the whole box) no matter where we split. The remaining terms have a minus sign in the variance formula, so we drop the minus sign and maximize the sum of the two terms.
